formalpara.title: Description
formalpara.para: A LENGTH ERROR in Parse[17] occurs with the following message.

listitem.screen: Parse[17] fd←+\0,¯1↓tm\fm ⍝ Nesting depths of functions

formalpara.title: Analysis
formalpara.para: In Parse[15] the use of ⌷ receives an incorrect input.

listitem.programlisting: fm←1 ¯1 0⌷⍨(,¨'{}')⍳'name'Prop tm⌿ns ⍝ Map of brackets, } ¯1, { 1, else 0
listitem.para: The result of the ⍳ is a vector of indices, and not a single index. This means we need to use ⊃¨⊂ instead. So to fix this we replace Parse[15] with the following.
listitem.programlisting: fm←(,¨'{}')⍳'name'Prop tm⌿ns ⍝ Class of each token namefm←fm⊃¨⊂1 ¯1 0 ⍝ Convert } → ¯1 ; { → 1 ; else → 0
